title: Data Structures and Algorithms
description: Fundamentals of data structures and algorithms, in C++.

skills: C++ language skills used to develop several projects focused on data structures and algorithms.
Data Structures including linked lists, trees, heaps, hash tables, and graphs.
Algorithms including sorting, searching, and graph traversal.
Focus on program optimization and testing using shell tools including valgrind and perf.

title: Intro to Computer Organization
description: Processor design, assembly, memory, and cache.

skills: C programming skills used to develop several projects focused on simulating a processor, memory, and cache.
ARM Assembly skills with a focus on fundamentals of assembly programs, including memory access, branching, and function calls.
Processor design and optimization skills, including pipelining, branch prediction, and cache design.

title: Web Systems
description: Covers fundamentals of web development and web systems design.

skills: Used multithreading in Python to handle multiple simultaneous tasks at once.
Developed and simulated distributed systems including a distributed compute design similar to MapReduce and a search index.
SQL (SQLite) used as a database for an instagram clone, storing user data, posts, and comments.
Sockets and Networking in Python to communicate with nodes in distributed systems.

title: Intro to Cybersecurity
description: Covers fundamentals of cybersecurity, including cryptography, network security, and software security.

skills: Cryptography skills focusing on symmetric and asymmetric encryption, as well as hashing.
Network Security skills focusing on attacks such as ARP spoofing, DNS spoofing, and TCP hijacking.
Software Security skills focusing on program vulnerabilities involving data injection and execution.
Python language skills used for automating attacks and using socket programming to communicate with external systems.
C and x86 assembly analysis and exploitation, including buffer overflows, format string vulnerabilities, and return-oriented programming.
